greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lexicographically earliest infinite sequence such that a(i) = a(j) => A318458(i) = A318458(j) and A336158(i) = A336158(j), for all i, j >= 1.
comment: Restricted growth sequence transform of the ordered pair [A318458(n), A336158(n)].
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
program: rgs_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), u=1); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), my(pp = mapget(om, invec[i])); outvec[i] = outvec[pp] , mapput(om,invec[i],i); outvec[i] = u; u++ )); outvec; };
A046523(n) = { my(f=vecsort(factor(n)[, 2], , 4), p); prod(i=1, #f, (p=nextprime(p+1))^f[i]); };  \\ From A046523
xref: Cf. A324389, A324530, A324531, A324532 for other similar constructions (also similar by their scatter plots).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 11 2020
